The victory was made complete in 1760 when, despite losing outside Quebec City in the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_3><a2_4><b7_0><b8_0>Battle of <a2_2>Sainte-Foy<b8_0/><b7_0/><a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, the British were able to prevent the arrival of French relief ships in the <a3_0>naval <a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><a3_4>Battle of the Restigouche<a3_4/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> while armies marched on Montreal from three sides.
